channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Basketball superstars Caitlin Clark and Angel Reese meet again on Monday
item.description: Monday's game won't end with a championship ring, but the stakes are still high. The matchup between two of college basketball's biggest stars will determine who will advance to the Final Four.
item.content:encoded:
Monday's game won't end with a championship ring, but the stakes are still high. The matchup between two of college basketball's biggest stars will determine who will advance to the Final Four.

(Image credit: Tony Gutierrez)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: 'No timeline' to recover 4 bodies after Baltimore bridge collapse, as cleanup begins
item.description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore called the recovery operation "complex" after a ship smashed into the Francis Scott Key Bridge. Officials have not given estimates on when the river will reopen to traffic.
item.content:encoded:
Maryland Gov. Wes Moore called the recovery operation "complex" after a ship smashed into the Francis Scott Key Bridge. Officials have not given estimates on when the river will reopen to traffic.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: For the first time, U.S. dairy cows have tested positive for bird flu
item.description: Livestock in Texas, Kansas and Michigan are confirmed to have the virus, and herds in New Mexico and Idaho have also tested positive. The threat to the public is low, federal officials say.
item.content:encoded:
Livestock in Texas, Kansas and Michigan are confirmed to have the virus, and herds in New Mexico and Idaho have also tested positive. The threat to the public is low, federal officials say.

(Image credit: Rodrigo Abd)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: 'SNL' sends up the NPR Tiny Desk with an intern who pleads, 'keep the ruckus down'
item.description: Saturday Night Live poked fun at NPR's Tiny Desk this weekend, with Bowen Yang playing the part of an aggravated intern who just wants the band to keep it down so he can get back to work.
item.content:encoded: Saturday Night Live poked fun at NPR's Tiny Desk this weekend, with Bowen Yang playing the part of an aggravated intern who just wants the band to keep it down so he can get back to work.
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: A Billionaire's Land Purchases In Rural Hawaii Have Locals Worried
item.description:
Hawaii is no stranger to extravagant homes owned by the super-rich. But when a tech billionaire started buying up land in Waimea, a small, rural town on the Big Island, the community got curious - and worried.

Locals fear it will become even more difficult for Native Hawaiians to afford to live in Waimea and buy property. In Hawaii, the average home price is close to a million dollars.

Who's purchasing all this land in rural Hawaii and how will it affect the already high cost of housing in Waimea?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Hawaii is no stranger to extravagant homes owned by the super-rich. But when a tech billionaire started buying up land in Waimea, a small, rural town on the Big Island, the community got curious - and worried.

Locals fear it will become even more difficult for Native Hawaiians to afford to live in Waimea and buy property. In Hawaii, the average home price is close to a million dollars.

Who's purchasing all this land in rural Hawaii and how will it affect the already high cost of housing in Waimea?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: Ronit Fahl)

item.title: A Florida activist creates safe spaces as laws and rhetoric turn against trans rights
item.description: In founding Capital Tea, Janel Diaz sought to provide the kind of services that she had needed after her transition.
item.content:encoded: In founding Capital Tea, Janel Diaz sought to provide the kind of services that she had needed after her transition.
item.dc:creator: Regan McCarthy

item.title: Las Vegas' famed Tropicana resort will close this week to make way for a new ballpark
item.description: When the Tropicana opened in 1957, it was the "Tiffany of the Strip," complete with showgirl revues, mob deals and James Bond. It will be demolished in October to build a new home for the Oakland A's.
item.content:encoded:
When the Tropicana opened in 1957, it was the "Tiffany of the Strip," complete with showgirl revues, mob deals and James Bond. It will be demolished in October to build a new home for the Oakland A's.

(Image credit: Ethan Miller)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Pope Francis appeals for peace in Gaza and Ukraine at Easter Mass
item.description: Pope Francis overcame concerns about his health to preside over Easter Sunday Mass, leading tens of thousands of people in a flower-decked St. Peter's Square.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis overcame concerns about his health to preside over Easter Sunday Mass, leading tens of thousands of people in a flower-decked St. Peter's Square.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)

item.title: Former U.S. Rep. William Delahunt of Massachusetts has died at age 82
item.description: Longtime U.S. Rep. William D. Delahunt of Massachusetts, a Democratic stalwart, has died following a long-term illness, his family announced.
item.content:encoded:
Longtime U.S. Rep. William D. Delahunt of Massachusetts, a Democratic stalwart, has died following a long-term illness, his family announced.

(Image credit: Steven Senne)

item.title: Government agents raid Peruvian President Boluarte's residence
item.description: Peruvian president Dina Boluarte is being investigated for allegedly acquiring an undisclosed collection of luxury watches since becoming vice president in 2021, and then president in 2022.
item.content:encoded:
Peruvian president Dina Boluarte is being investigated for allegedly acquiring an undisclosed collection of luxury watches since becoming vice president in 2021, and then president in 2022.

(Image credit: Martin Mejia)
